result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Devine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A Devine in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

60 DAYS JAIL.

TERM OF PROBATION:   1 YEAR; (PROBATION MAY BE TRANSFERRED TO MILWAUKEE COUNTY).

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with victim Samantha D. with the exception to facilitate child exchange as outlined through the custody agreement.
*DNA sample/surcharge waived bases on date of violation. 
*Domestic Violence Counseling.
*Perform 50 Hours Community Service. 

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME: 25 Days, STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.
Sentencing hearing at 02-24-2016 08:30 am
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court strikes the domestic abuse enhancer and finds defendant guilty.  The Court sets the matter for sentencing to allow for victim notification.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person at 02-23-2016 08:15 am
Jury status hearing at 02-18-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court with attorney Adam Schleis for Samuel W. Benedict.  Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Samuel W. Benedict in court.   Defendant Joshua A Devine did not appear.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant called the Clerk's office to advise the Defendant is in the hospital. Attorney Schleiss requests that both cases be set for trial.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/29/15.
Hearing at 10-29-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court with attorney Eryn Menden for attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests another date. Court grants request. Discovery given to defense.  Hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 09-25-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises there is another referral and there is a global pretrial offer. Court will set this matter (15CM694) over. File 15CM1586 to be sent in on the next date. Both files to be addressed.  Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has not made an offer. State has another referral involving the defendant. State would request another 30 days to make an offer to the defendant.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation and/or speak to another Attorney with the Veteran's administration/affairs. Court will give another date in 45 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Plea questionnaire and waiver received in court but plea was not taken.

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The Defendant advises the Court he wishes to waive his right to an attorney.  The case is recalled and the Defendant is sworn and testifies regarding his request for waiver of attorney.  The Court grants the Defendant's request to waive an attorney.  The State is to provide an offer to the Defendant via mail within the week.  The Court will not proceed to plea today and does not take the Defendant's plea at this time.
Hearing on June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint except for child placement.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Joshua A Devine in court.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorne  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.
